wms_article.title: HD Hyundai acquires Doosan Enerbility’s Vietnam unit

wms_article_body.body: HD Hyundai Group announced on Wednesday that it acquired Doosan Enerbility’s Vietnam subsidiary Doosan Vina for 290 billion won ($213.24 million). HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering, the group’s intermediate holding company for shipbuilding, said it signed a contract to purchase all of Doosan Vina’s shares, adding the facility will serve as a production base for eco-friendly ship components and as a hub for port crane operations in Asia. Formed in 2006 about 120 kilometers south of Da Nang, Doosan Vina manufactures thermal power plant boilers, port cranes, and liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant modules. HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering said the site will primarily function as a base for independent tanks, which are essential components for LNG-powered vessels, liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) carriers, and ammonia carriers. Demand for these types of tanks has been steadily increasing in line with the International Maritime Organization (IMO) strengthening environmental regulations, the company added.
